channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: NASA used Claude to plot a route for its Perseverance rover on Mars
item.description: Since 2021, NASA's Perseverance rover has achieved a number of historic milestones, including sending back the first audio recordings from Mars. Now, nearly five years after landing on the Red Planet, it just achieved another feat. This past December, Perseverance successfully completed a route through a section of the Jezero crater plotted by Anthropic's Claude chatbot, marking the first time NASA has used a large language model to pilot the car-sized robot. Between December 8 and 10, Perseverance drove approximately 400 meters (about 437 yards) through a field of rocks on the Martian sur...

item.title: Fitbit users now have until May to migrate to a Google account
item.description: Fitbit users who are holding out on moving their data over to a Google account now have until May 19th, 2026 to make the switch. The previous deadline was just days away on February 2nd, but that date has been updated on Google's help page for Fitbit account migration. The post also now specifies that, […]

item.title: Could Poop Pills Be a Secret Weapon Against Cancer?
item.description: Two new studies highlight the potential of fecal microbiota transplantation as a boon to cancer immunotherapy.

item.title: Seeing Is Believing at Your Own Peril in ‘After God’
item.description: Sumi Eno's dystopian fantasy manga is a criminally underrated hidden gem that's writing circles around its contemporaries.

item.title: Wave bland wall spaces goodbye: I tested two of my fave digital photo frames head-to-head, and this option is perfect for giving gloomy winter rooms a glow-up
item.description: I pit my two fave digital photo frames against each other – while both are absolutely gorgeous, this is the one that will light up your living room the most.

item.title: Google’s Project Genie Is Not for You
item.description: Google tries the Yann LeCun approach.

item.title: Rivian made an electric ambulance for Grey's Anatomy
item.description: America’s once-promising EV transition may have taken a U-turn, but at least some in Hollywood are trying to do their part. Rivian partnered with Grey’s Anatomy to make a custom electric ambulance for the long-running series.The ambulance is a modified version of Rivian’s Commercial Van. The custom “vanbulance” serves a dual purpose: preventing on-set exhaust fumes (which could harm the cast and crew) and integrating a green storyline. “As an added benefit, the elimination of engine noise brought a welcome quiet while cameras were rolling,” Rivan wrote in a blog post.Among other modifications,...

item.title: 3 Great Heated Blanket Deals on My Favorite Affordable Models
item.description: Some of our favorite heated blankets are on sale (and might even arrive in time for you to use this weekend).

item.title: SpaceX’s IPO could open the floodgates — and secondaries are booming in the meantime
item.description: To unpack what SpaceX’s IPO chatter means, how private liquidity works before a debut, and what investors are looking for in today’s pre-IPO giants, we spoke with Greg Martin, managing director at Rainmaker Securities, a broker-dealer specializing in secondary share transactions for late-stage private companies.

item.title: This startup, backed by Bill Gates, is looking to transform computing as we know it - optical transistors could upend Moore's Law and allow more powerful GPUs
item.description: Neurophos develops optical GPU Tulkas T100, achieving 470 petaFLOPS, high RAM, and SSD integration, aiming to advance AI computation.

item.title: US Declassifies Vintage Spy Satellite With a Wildly Lopsided Orbit
item.description: JUMPSEAT launched from 1971 to 1987 to collect intelligence during the Cold War-era.

item.title: There’s a social network for AI agents, and it’s getting weird
item.description: Yes, you read that right. "Moltbook" is a social network of sorts for AI agents, particularly ones offered by OpenClaw (a viral AI assistant project that was formerly known as Moltbot, and before that, known as Clawdbot - until a legal dispute with Anthropic). Moltbook, which is set up similarly to Reddit and was built […]

item.title: This $110 standing desk deal from our favorite maker fixes the biggest design flaw found on almost every other budget model
item.description: FlexiSpot’s EN1 standing desk features a sturdy one-piece 48×24-inch desktop with smooth electric height adjustment, and it’s just received a $60 price cut.

item.title: We finally heard from Trump Mobile… and they immediately ghosted us
item.description: Where's the Trump phone? We're going to keep talking about it every week. We've reached out, as usual, to ask about the Trump phone's whereabouts. As usual, we're still waiting for a response. In the meantime, I finally got a reply from a company exec. After months - months - of emailing various official Trump […]

item.title: IKEA's cosy lighting will will give your home a glow-up to beat the winter blues, with prices from just £7
item.description: Add a splash of warmth to any room, without touching the thermostat.

item.title: JBL Flip 7 vs Bose SoundLink Flex Gen 2: two audio giants, only one winner
item.description: I pitted JBL against Bose in this showdown of two audio behemoths, but there was only ever going to be one champion.

item.title: 200 expériences dans la Station spatiale : ce que Sophie Adenot va vraiment tester dans l’espace pendant 9 mois
item.description: Alors que son départ approche, c'est l'occasion de faire un point sur les expériences que mènera Sophie Adenot durant son séjour de neuf mois dans la Station spatiale internationale.

item.title: Uber is literally in the driver’s seat when it comes to AV bets
item.description: Self-driving truck startup Waabi’s billion-dollar fundraise isn’t just about trucks. The deal, for $750 million up front plus another $250 million from Uber tied to deployment milestones, marks a major expansion into robotaxis for the company founded by former Uber AI chief Raquel Urtasun. It also feels like another chip from Uber on the autonomous vehicle roulette table. With more […]...

item.title: Catherine O’Hara, Star of ‘Beetlejuice’ and ‘Home Alone,’ Has Died
item.description: The comedic legend also starred in 'Schitt's Creek,' 'Best in Show,' 'The Last of Us,' and so much more.

item.title: Dyson’s powerful 360 Vis Nav robot vacuum is nearly 75 percent off today
item.description: In case you missed it, we recently overhauled our guides to the best budget robot vacuums and the best mopping vacs, both of which feature a slate of new picks from Roborock, Narwal, Dreame, and others. Dyson’s 360 Vis Nav Robot Vacuum didn’t technically make the cut, though it was once one of our top […]

item.title: This Robot Hand Pops Off and Crawls. I Hate It So Much.
item.description: Like a robotic spider! But somehow worse!

item.title: How to use psychology to shift a difficult relationship into a healthier one
item.description: By addressing the underlying need for emotional safety, you can work toward more secure relationships. Relationships can feel like both a blessing and the bane of your existence, a source of joy and a source of frustration or resentment. At some point, each of us is faced with a clingy child, a dramatic friend, a partner who recoils at the first hint of intimacy, a volatile parent, or a controlling boss — in short, a difficult relationship....
